name: groundcover
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing groundcover resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`groundcover` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/groundcover-com/terraform-provider-groundcover).

apiKey.description: groundcover API Key. Can also be set via the GROUNDCOVER_API_KEY environment variable.

apiUrl.description: groundcover API URL. Defaults to the groundcover production URL. Can also be set via the GROUNDCOVER_API_URL environment variable.

backendId.description: groundcover Backend ID. Can also be set via the GROUNDCOVER_BACKEND_ID environment variable.

orgName.description: groundcover Organization Name. Can also be set via the GROUNDCOVER_ORG_NAME environment variable. Deprecated: Use backend_id instead.

advanced.description: Advanced data scope configuration. Allows per-data-type filtering rules for fine-grained access control.

simple.description: Simple data scope configuration. Applies a single set of filtering rules to all data types.

conditions.description: List of conditions for the data scope.

disabled.description: Whether this data type is disabled (no data access). When true, users have no access to this data type.

filters.description: List of filter criteria for the condition.

provider.description:
The provider type for the groundcover package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

groundcover:index/monitor:Monitor.description:
groundcover Monitor resource managed via raw YAML.

## Example Usage

<!--Start PulumiCodeChooser -->
```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as groundcover from "@groundcover-com/groundcover";

const config = new pulumi.Config();
const groundcoverApiKey = config.require("groundcoverApiKey");
const groundcoverBackendId = config.require("groundcoverBackendId");
// Example Monitor: K8s Pod Crash Looping using monitor_yaml
const k8sPodCrashLooping = new groundcover.Monitor("k8sPodCrashLooping", {monitorYaml: `title: K8s Pod Crash Looping
display:
  header: K8s Pod Crash Looping
  resourceHeaderLabels:
  - workload
  contextHeaderLabels:
  - cluster
  - namespace
  - workload
  description: Kubernetes pod is on a CrashLoopBackOff for more than 5 minutes
severity: S2
measurementType: event
model:
  queries:
  - dataType: metrics
    name: threshold_input_query
    pipeline:
      function:
        name: avg_over_time
        pipelines:
        - function:
            name: avg_by
            pipelines:
            - metric: groundcover_kube_pod_container_status_waiting_reason
            args:
            - cluster
            - namespace
            - workload
        args:
        - 5m
    conditions:
    - key: reason
      origin: root
      type: string
      filters:
      - op: match
        value: CrashLoopBackOff
  thresholds:
  - name: threshold_1
    inputName: threshold_input_query
    operator: gt
    values:
    - 0
executionErrorState: OK
evaluationInterval:
  interval: 1m0s
  pendingFor: 5m0s
`});
export const monitorExampleId = k8sPodCrashLooping.id;
export const monitorExampleYamlOutput = k8sPodCrashLooping.monitorYaml;
```
```python
import pulumi
import groundcover_groundcover as groundcover

config = pulumi.Config()
groundcover_api_key = config.require("groundcoverApiKey")
groundcover_backend_id = config.require("groundcoverBackendId")
# Example Monitor: K8s Pod Crash Looping using monitor_yaml
k8s_pod_crash_looping = groundcover.Monitor("k8sPodCrashLooping", monitor_yaml="""title: K8s Pod Crash Looping
display:
  header: K8s Pod Crash Looping
  resourceHeaderLabels:
  - workload
  contextHeaderLabels:
  - cluster
  - namespace
  - workload
  description: Kubernetes pod is on a CrashLoopBackOff for more than 5 minutes
severity: S2
measurementType: event
model:
  queries:
  - dataType: metrics
    name: threshold_input_query
    pipeline:
      function:
        name: avg_over_time
        pipelines:
        - function:
            name: avg_by
            pipelines:
            - metric: groundcover_kube_pod_container_status_waiting_reason
            args:
            - cluster
            - namespace
            - workload
        args:
        - 5m
    conditions:
    - key: reason
      origin: root
      type: string
      filters:
      - op: match
        value: CrashLoopBackOff
  thresholds:
  - name: threshold_1
    inputName: threshold_input_query
    operator: gt
    values:
    - 0
executionErrorState: OK
evaluationInterval:
  interval: 1m0s
  pendingFor: 5m0s
""")
pulumi.export("monitorExampleId", k8s_pod_crash_looping.id)
pulumi.export("monitorExampleYamlOutput", k8s_pod_crash_looping.monitor_yaml)
```
```csharp
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using Pulumi;
using Groundcover = GroundcoverCom.Groundcover;

return await Deployment.RunAsync(() => 
{
    var config = new Config();
    var groundcoverApiKey = config.Require("groundcoverApiKey");
    var groundcoverBackendId = config.Require("groundcoverBackendId");
    // Example Monitor: K8s Pod Crash Looping using monitor_yaml
    var k8sPodCrashLooping = new Groundcover.Monitor("k8sPodCrashLooping", new()
    {
        MonitorYaml = @"title: K8s Pod Crash Looping
display:
  header: K8s Pod Crash Looping
  resourceHeaderLabels:
  - workload
  contextHeaderLabels:
  - cluster
  - namespace
  - workload
  description: Kubernetes pod is on a CrashLoopBackOff for more than 5 minutes
severity: S2
measurementType: event
model:
  queries:
  - dataType: metrics
    name: threshold_input_query
    pipeline:
      function:
        name: avg_over_time
        pipelines:
        - function:
            name: avg_by
            pipelines:
            - metric: groundcover_kube_pod_container_status_waiting_reason
            args:
            - cluster
            - namespace
            - workload
        args:
        - 5m
    conditions:
    - key: reason
      origin: root
      type: string
      filters:
      - op: match
        value: CrashLoopBackOff
  thresholds:
  - name: threshold_1
    inputName: threshold_input_query
    operator: gt
    values:
    - 0
executionErrorState: OK
evaluationInterval:
  interval: 1m0s
  pendingFor: 5m0s
",
    });

    return new Dictionary<string, object?>
    {
        ["monitorExampleId"] = k8sPodCrashLooping.Id,
        ["monitorExampleYamlOutput"] = k8sPodCrashLooping.MonitorYaml,
    };
});
```
```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/groundcover-com/pulumi-groundcover/sdk/go/groundcover"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi/config"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		cfg := config.New(ctx, "")
		groundcoverApiKey := cfg.Require("groundcoverApiKey")
		groundcoverBackendId := cfg.Require("groundcoverBackendId")
		// Example Monitor: K8s Pod Crash Looping using monitor_yaml
		k8sPodCrashLooping, err := groundcover.NewMonitor(ctx, "k8sPodCrashLooping", &groundcover.MonitorArgs{
			MonitorYaml: pulumi.String(`title: K8s Pod Crash Looping
display:
  header: K8s Pod Crash Looping
  resourceHeaderLabels:
  - workload
  contextHeaderLabels:
  - cluster
  - namespace
  - workload
  description: Kubernetes pod is on a CrashLoopBackOff for more than 5 minutes
severity: S2
measurementType: event
model:
  queries:
  - dataType: metrics
    name: threshold_input_query
    pipeline:
      function:
        name: avg_over_time
        pipelines:
        - function:
            name: avg_by
            pipelines:
            - metric: groundcover_kube_pod_container_status_waiting_reason
            args:
            - cluster
            - namespace
            - workload
        args:
        - 5m
    conditions:
    - key: reason
      origin: root
      type: string
      filters:
      - op: match
        value: CrashLoopBackOff
  thresholds:
  - name: threshold_1
    inputName: threshold_input_query
    operator: gt
    values:
    - 0
executionErrorState: OK
evaluationInterval:
  interval: 1m0s
  pendingFor: 5m0s
`),
		})
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		ctx.Export("monitorExampleId", k8sPodCrashLooping.ID())
		ctx.Export("monitorExampleYamlOutput", k8sPodCrashLooping.MonitorYaml)
		return nil
	})
}
```
```java
package generated_program;

import com.pulumi.Context;
import com.pulumi.Pulumi;
import com.pulumi.core.Output;
import com.pulumi.groundcover.Monitor;
import com.pulumi.groundcover.MonitorArgs;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Map;
import java.io.File;
import java.nio.file.Files;
import java.nio.file.Paths;

public class App {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Pulumi.run(App::stack);
    }

    public static void stack(Context ctx) {
        final var config = ctx.config();
        final var groundcoverApiKey = config.get("groundcoverApiKey");
        final var groundcoverBackendId = config.get("groundcoverBackendId");
        // Example Monitor: K8s Pod Crash Looping using monitor_yaml
        var k8sPodCrashLooping = new Monitor("k8sPodCrashLooping", MonitorArgs.builder()
            .monitorYaml("""
title: K8s Pod Crash Looping
display:
  header: K8s Pod Crash Looping
  resourceHeaderLabels:
  - workload
  contextHeaderLabels:
  - cluster
  - namespace
  - workload
  description: Kubernetes pod is on a CrashLoopBackOff for more than 5 minutes
severity: S2
measurementType: event
model:
  queries:
  - dataType: metrics
    name: threshold_input_query
    pipeline:
      function:
        name: avg_over_time
        pipelines:
        - function:
            name: avg_by
            pipelines:
            - metric: groundcover_kube_pod_container_status_waiting_reason
            args:
            - cluster
            - namespace
            - workload
        args:
        - 5m
    conditions:
    - key: reason
      origin: root
      type: string
      filters:
      - op: match
        value: CrashLoopBackOff
  thresholds:
  - name: threshold_1
    inputName: threshold_input_query
    operator: gt
    values:
    - 0
executionErrorState: OK
evaluationInterval:
  interval: 1m0s
  pendingFor: 5m0s
            """)
            .build());

        ctx.export("monitorExampleId", k8sPodCrashLooping.id());
        ctx.export("monitorExampleYamlOutput", k8sPodCrashLooping.monitorYaml());
    }
}
```
```yaml
configuration:
  groundcoverApiKey:
    type: string
  groundcoverBackendId:
    type: string
resources:
  # Example Monitor: K8s Pod Crash Looping using monitor_yaml
  k8sPodCrashLooping:
    type: groundcover:Monitor
    properties:
      monitorYaml: |
        title: K8s Pod Crash Looping
        display:
          header: K8s Pod Crash Looping
          resourceHeaderLabels:
          - workload
          contextHeaderLabels:
          - cluster
          - namespace
          - workload
          description: Kubernetes pod is on a CrashLoopBackOff for more than 5 minutes
        severity: S2
        measurementType: event
        model:
          queries:
          - dataType: metrics
            name: threshold_input_query
            pipeline:
              function:
                name: avg_over_time
                pipelines:
                - function:
                    name: avg_by
                    pipelines:
                    - metric: groundcover_kube_pod_container_status_waiting_reason
                    args:
                    - cluster
                    - namespace
                    - workload
                args:
                - 5m
            conditions:
            - key: reason
              origin: root
              type: string
              filters:
              - op: match
                value: CrashLoopBackOff
          thresholds:
          - name: threshold_1
            inputName: threshold_input_query
            operator: gt
            values:
            - 0
        executionErrorState: OK
        evaluationInterval:
          interval: 1m0s
          pendingFor: 5m0s
outputs:
  monitorExampleId: ${k8sPodCrashLooping.id}
  # Note: Accessing specific fields like 'title' directly is not possible
  # when using monitor_yaml, as the structure is opaque to Terraform.
  # You would need to parse the YAML output if required.
  monitorExampleYamlOutput: ${k8sPodCrashLooping.monitorYaml}
```

pulumi:providers:groundcover/terraformCo.description: This function returns a Terraform config object with terraform-namecased keys,to be used with the Terraform Module Provider.
